website_summaries.verdict: These guards are a good choice for light-to-medium contact sparring.
pros: Offer light protection for sparring practice or for injured and sensitive areas
Covers entire kicking area from instep to top of shin
Cloth material holds up to regular use and washing
Comes in a variety of sizes
Pads can be removed for washing
cons: Stitching on the bottom of the foot can bunch up during a long sparring session

customer_reviews.title: These are not PROFORCE
customer_reviews.text: These came in a bag with a different company name on the bag and a generic sticker stuck to it that said ProForce. I bought another pair of these same exact size for my other daughter from a different seller. They came in a bag that Had Proforce printed on the bag itself. There is a huge difference between the two. The part that goes on the top of the foot is about 1 1/2 inches shorter than the real ProForce. The company will not allow me to return the product. There is no way it will fit my daughter it leaves almost her hole foot exposed. Very disappointed and angry over this one.
customer_reviews.author: LittleBits of Life

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these kick pads expecting the worst. They arrived promptly and to my surprise they are a great looking and feeling set of pads. I'm an independent pro wrestler / referee and these are awesome for what I need them for. My kids are into MMA and they enjoy these for sparring and kicking around, pun intended. I would recommend this set of kick pads. I'll update this as i use them. And for those wondering they are a size large and yes you can wear them over sneakers. Just put the pads on the sneaker first.
customer_reviews.author: Jackjack

customer_reviews.title: Pads remove easily for washing
customer_reviews.text: I've bought three pair of these. One pair for me and two pair for other family members. I have had mine about 3 years. They have held up with regular use and periodical washing. Pads remove easily for washing. I've found that they stay in place and allow ease of movement. Unlike other sparring skin pads that Velcro around the leg, these do not shift, come loose, or feel cumbersome under my pants.
customer_reviews.author: K. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable on foot bottom due to bump in stitching
customer_reviews.text: Bought for karate. These are fairly uncomfortable, as the design is poor: the 2 ends of the elastic edging of the front of the shin guard meet on the underside (foot bottom) of the shin guard, not the top. The stitching holding the 2 ends together, as well as the slight overlap of the elastic itself, create an uncomfortable bump against the foot arch when standing. Like a small and irritating pebble under your foot. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good padding for light sparrring.
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my kung fu class. The school sold a different type of padding for about half the price but I ripped through those in just a couple of months. These have been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Cutter

customer_reviews.title: This are great started guards
customer_reviews.text: This are great started guards. When he starts kicking the heavy bags I will invest in a more sturdy better protection pair but for now these are perfect. My son is 11 and does kickboxing 3 days a week at 1.5 hours each time and they have held up well, no complaints and he says they are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Light weight and easy to put on. Size is as described. It's little big for my 5 year old who wears size 12 shoes, but enough to cover his toes. So for practical use on daily training he wears these. It comes up to his knees, but enough for him to move around without any issues. He told me that the bottom was uncomfortable and I immediately knew why. There is a thick knot from end of sewing which can cause discomfort. I had the same issue with my old ones. Ended up cutting a little piece out then folded and sewed for a flatter ending. He has no issues now.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kim

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch
customer_reviews.text: These fit as expected and are easy to clean. I've owned them for almost 6 years now and they still look and function great. I use them once a week religiously, and they take a beating. When the smell gets to be too much (about once a quarter) I'll throw then in the wash on hot, then dry them in the machine and they never shrink. If they were to ever fail, I would buy them again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Conner Skylstad

customer_reviews.title: These were fine
customer_reviews.text: I used these for a kick boxing class and found the shin guards to work fine, not great. After using the shin guards once the material ripped, but were still functional. As well kicking still really hurts even with these on so keep that in mind. I didn't have an issue with these shin guards slipping like with other shin guards, rather I found that elastic around the foot is too tight and gets to be uncomfortable as time goes on. Pro Relatively cheap Provides enough protection Cons Not super sturdy and ripped after one use The elastic around the foot is very tight and gets to be too uncomfortable over time
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great protectors, a little bit hard to put in ...
customer_reviews.text: Great protectors, a little bit hard to put in once my kid is already sweating but I love the fact that stays in place and protects completely his leg and feet. Size chart very accurate. Strongly Recommended
customer_reviews.author: ColorMeLife

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, stays on even after kicking hard
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, stays on even after kicking hard, and they are comfortable, would recommend for those sparing. Its probably not a good idea to have white fabric because their going to get dirty. Overall it a great product you should try it.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Ruckus

customer_reviews.title: These are good shin guards but they have their faults
customer_reviews.text: I like these however the only thing is that when I wore these on a training mat to spar the bottom of the guards were touching the mat and it made it feel like you were wearing socks and I felt like if I threw a kick I'd slip so that's the main downside of these but next time I'll probably roll the bottom a little so I won't feel like I'll slip. The only other thing is that it takes a little work to put these on and it's easiest to pull them inside out to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: No more lumps
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, I got these cuz I was getting tired of lumpy shins from checking kicks. I figured I would get these for my next class then buy better ones for competition. These work great and I don't need higher priced ones.
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Valenzuela

customer_reviews.title: Not going to last long
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, however they will not last more than 10-15 wears before severe degrade.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: too big for skinny legs
customer_reviews.text: It's still a bit too big for skinny legs. It's pulling down during my kickboxing training, and doesn't cover feet well.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Great for sparring
customer_reviews.text: These pads are adequately padded while still being flexible and lightweight so they are comfortable for sparring. The surrounding material is soft too, and they seem quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Joy

customer_reviews.title: so was an easy choice. These can be a little tight on ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used these plenty of times before, so was an easy choice. These can be a little tight on larger calves, or, people with large insteps, so you may want to size up. I primarily use these for light shin protection and wear my sparring 'booties' over them - this give the added bonus that the boots fit snugger and move less when kicks are deflected.
customer_reviews.author: ConBran

customer_reviews.title: Wrong item
customer_reviews.text: I ordered, and paid for, the instep/ shin guard. I received a shin guard ONLY. When sparing, I'm required to have padding down my shin and over the tops of my feet which the instep/ shin guard provides. It's not worth my time or money to return this item and who knows if they'll get it right, the next time. I'm, now left to find somewhere else to purchase them.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit. Perfect padding when you want to spar ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. Perfect padding when you want to spar and feel the impact. If you have newbie shins, these might not be the ones for you. Intermediate to advanced, getsome!
customer_reviews.author: OG

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with the kick pads however, they are a bit tight on me but overall great product.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Cedeno

customer_reviews.title: Very Protective and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: My grandson love using these shin guards For spiring and practicing his karate
customer_reviews.author: monique

customer_reviews.title: Good guards
customer_reviews.text: These rarely if ever twist around the shin. They don't offer the best protection, but for the price they are great for bag training. With sparring you need to be careful. I actually use them in combination with the strap-on shin guards from Century and they actually help in preventiing those from twisting around. Plus you get double-protection. It's a good combo and no one will notice under your Gi.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Picture not at all acurate!
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment!The shin guards in the picture have protection for the feet. I ordered according to the picture and that's NOT what we received! Totally different! These actually go from the knee to the ankle...NOT to the feet(no foot protection).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good produts!
customer_reviews.text: There are objects scattered around at a level to my lower legs in my work place and I have chances to bump into these objects and get my legs hurt while walking around. I bought these shin guards to protect my legs especially the shin part from getiing hurt if bumped into the objects while walking around carelessly. These shin guards work well upto my expectations and worth well just over ten bucks a pair.
customer_reviews.author: Picky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for training
customer_reviews.text: My son used these to train and days they fit good and work great
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Conner

customer_reviews.title: Good for practice.
customer_reviews.text: Good practice guards. Have some difficulty getting them off after... Don’t recommend them for competing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reese

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shin pads for all combat sports that require shin ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shin pads for all combat sports that require shin pads during training. I train 6days a week and these bad boys always get the job done. Great fit, great price, extremely comfy, great for mma amd what I like the most is there light and don't move like most shin guards.Definitely a dope product. Especially if you insist on protecting your shins and being able to train without having to stop to adjust your shin guards every ten seconds like I do. Check it out and check me out @oldmanvancleave for future updates on all worthy products I've tried in the fitness world.
customer_reviews.author: BRANDON V.

customer_reviews.title: Great protection but also easy to move around in
customer_reviews.text: Great protection but also easy to move around in. If you are used to sparring foam "shoes" be careful as these don't project the toes. I actually broke a toe the first time I used these. It was my own fault as I was used to the thick foam - definitely not a product problem. Other people in the Dojo have what asked where they can get these.
customer_reviews.author: Traumadoc2002

customer_reviews.title: Less swelling in my face.
customer_reviews.text: At least now when she whoops my a**, my gf’s feet are protected...
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for decent kick pads for my next prowrestling show. These work very well and look nice despite the low price. I may order a couple other colors.
customer_reviews.author: DAVEandCOURTNEY WAYSONTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sizing might be an issue
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the "Small" size and package label said "MEDIUM" on each side, with an additional sticker that had the UPC code that said "SMALL." Labels sewn into the actual guards said "MEDIUM." On ProForce's website, there was only a 1-inch difference in length. I was afraid they'd just pull another UPC SMALL off the shelf if I tried to exchange it. They might all be the same width anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Karen in NC

customer_reviews.title: Plain to look at . Good to drill takedowns or roll with
customer_reviews.text: No frills, dull to look at. Great performance for the price. Strong material and stitching . Good protection for kicking mixed with grappling. My only complaint is theres a noticeable gap between the tarsal/instep pad and the tibia/shin pad , leaving the top inch of the ankle area completely unprotected so i would not use these for real hard sparring , but not bad for light striking during grappling focussed drills
customer_reviews.author: Frank B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and easy to put on
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and easy to put on. While not as 'fancy' or as protective as some other shin guards, I find these to be the best bang for your buck. Also, in my experience these things last forever, while the more expensive foam versions with straps tend to break apart over time. I got way more mileage out of my first pair of these than most of my friends did with their more expensive kind.
customer_reviews.author: David Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those of us who bruise easily
customer_reviews.text: Allows you to feel the kick but takes the sting and bruising away.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Now I can relax!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot describe how relieved I am to finally find something that really makes my damaged shin (car accident, nerves healing gradually) feel protected from wayward car doors, scooting dogs, or kids flopping on your lap... I can just pull on this protector, and relax.
customer_reviews.author: N. McBride

customer_reviews.title: Good For Light Sparring
customer_reviews.text: These arrived super fast! Next day! (Prime member) I bought them for some light Tang Soo Do sparring. I'm 5'7 with pretty muscular size 19 calves and I originally ordered a medium, which didn't fit. I was going to then order the large but went with the XL and they fit fine. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Good for keeping branches from scratching my shins
customer_reviews.text: That's what I bought them for. I'm a federal survey Tech. that does a lot of hiking or I should say a lot of crashing through brush and my shins get tore up, these have stopped that from happening. I haven't kicked anyone in the face with them on, i will let you know how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: ray

customer_reviews.title: I use these and they are pretty good for the purpose I use them for which ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these and they are pretty good for the purpose I use them for which is to cushion my legs from a metal bar when I do my sit-ups - but I am a woman and I have 14inch calves and I use the large.
customer_reviews.author: arwen g.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff, fair price!
customer_reviews.text: They are good. Just a little more loose than I prefer, but for the price I'm not going to be a bitch a out it.
customer_reviews.author: Wilsey

customer_reviews.title: DON'T PULL ANY THREADS! EVEN IF THEY LOOK LIKE THEY'RE ALREADY DETACHED
customer_reviews.text: These were cheap and perfect for what I need at the moment, however, when I went to pull what looked like a stray thread, the entire stitching between the foot and shin pad began to completely unravel. Will be calling Amazon to see about either replacing them with something else or getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price+quality=great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 14-yr old son, who is a Kyokushin karateka. He stands at 5'8", 172 lbs- on his way to being a giant. They are affordable, comfortable and are withstanding the abuse of shin kicks, and shin checking. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: macpasch

customer_reviews.title: If you reorder they may send something else
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these as my son's fit me perfectly. I was sent a pair that was not the pro force brand. They are approximately a 1/2 inch less in width on top, 1/4 less wide on the foot and 1/2 inch shorter. The hole for the heel is also tighter and smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use them 3-5 times a week amd have to ...
customer_reviews.text: I use them 3-5 times a week amd have to replace them about every 3-4 months. They also don't protect your toes when sparring.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Schneider

customer_reviews.title: great product for realistic sparring
customer_reviews.text: purchased for sparring near fights, they are thin and provide minimal protection which i prefer closer to a fight to gain shin conditioning for checking. its made fairly but not top quality, but for the price completely as i expected. i would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: micah wagner

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even receive the right product. Foam is thin.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered product did not match the pics. What I received didn't include the instep guard. The foam is also very thin. If you're serious about it, spend the extra $20 for leather/gel guards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the way I can slide them on and off ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for myself for Karate class. I like the way I can slide them on and off and not have to worry about them coming loose on me when sparing. Works great in class, just not thick enough for competition if I was to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for sparring. No adjustments needed.
customer_reviews.text: I really like that these pads slip on, and don't need Velcro straps. I've seen others whose straps come loose, and they have to stop to refasten them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fordyce

customer_reviews.title: Not what's pictured
customer_reviews.text: The shin guards I received are not what is pictured or described. They have no part that wraps around the foot nor does it have padding over the foot. They are just basic shin guards.
customer_reviews.author: Doowa

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son, for wrestling. Great item. Many others have asked about them.
customer_reviews.author: NorCal man

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Protection
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice fit. I wear them for softball. As a pitcher I wanted some shin protection from line drives. I cut off the foot portion as that part is not comfortable. Only change I'd like to see is Velcro straps to hold in place rather than having to pull them on over the foot.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: For the price, don't think twice ! Easy to put on and remove, great protection.
customer_reviews.author: bob 2012

customer_reviews.title: Ok, fits well
customer_reviews.text: Fits my son pretty well, will probably fit for at least 6 mos or so. His only complaint is the tag on the rear of the knee, definitely yank that thing off. Might need to fold the back down a bit and sew it also, will have him try again next class and see if it irritates him less.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H. Georg

customer_reviews.title: Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: Bought size M for my 7 yr old and 10 yr old according to the size description and they couldn't even wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Umm Hady

customer_reviews.title: They are perfect for TKD practice and fit great
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 pairs one for my son and for myself. They are perfect for TKD practice and fit great!
customer_reviews.author: Gina C. Adler

customer_reviews.title: I think it's good quality for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: They fit. Not very protective but if you want more protection you gotta pay more for it. I think it's good quality for a beginner. I'm a beginner so I won't be needing much protection anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and just enough padding
customer_reviews.text: Light and easy to move around in. Be sure you get a proper size. I don't really have any more issues getting em off then I have any other shin protector once they get sweaty. Good level of padding if you're not going full on "potential injury" level sparring. Point sparring is fine. I recommend wearing em for abit on your own time to get used to moving in em though. I slipped at one point on a bit of the cloth because I put em on fresh out of the packaging for a sparring night, wasn't used to sin/instep style.
customer_reviews.author: Eric P.

customer_reviews.title: Fit great on your legs you don't have to worry about ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit great on your legs you don't have to worry about them slipping especially if you have big calf muscles like I do only have one pair and haven't had the need to replace them in almost 5 months
customer_reviews.author: Jon l.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible and false advertised
customer_reviews.text: Terrible and false advertised. I bought these to get back into the gym again and needed some shin guard with instep and I only received this. If I knew I was just going to receive shin guards I wouldn't have ordered them! Will be returning ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very stiff
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to replace ones for my son's martial arts. Very stiff. Missed my return window.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail L Gehring

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for kick pads to finish off my wrestling attire and these ProForce kick pads were the perfect addition. They fit just as I had wanted them to and they really comfortable. I like the feel of the kick pads and I like that I can remove the pads inside of them for washing. I'm so happy I found these kick pads on this site. I'm more than happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Luciano Chavez Jr.

customer_reviews.title: small and poor quality
customer_reviews.text: its very tight on me (female slender legs) and seems poor quality- would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: ) The fit is perfect and whenever I do use them for kick boxing
customer_reviews.text: These are so comfy, I sometimes use them around the house to keep my legs warm :) The fit is perfect and whenever I do use them for kick boxing, they protect my shins from injuries while still allowing me to feel impact.
customer_reviews.author: B.Brown

customer_reviews.title: Protect your shins
customer_reviews.text: Although the padding doesn't feel like much, it's enough to take the sting out of kicking the heavy bag. I can throw a hard roundhouse without breaking my leg.
customer_reviews.author: HJ

customer_reviews.title: Good Muay Thai Shinguard!
customer_reviews.text: This shin pads fit great. I do full contact Muay Thai kickboxing, so lots of throwing and checking kicks, and these hold up well. I bought the XL versions because I have very big calves and they fit snugly but don't cut circulation. They also offer good protection while still conditioning your shins a bit since they are foam. And they don't slide around much when you take a hit on them. I'd buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Un

customer_reviews.title: Good protection at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses these when sparing. They really help. I also use them and have really noticed a difference. They are cloth with a foam protection inside. Comfortable to wear. Not easy to take off when your sweaty but overall, a nice product and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit for spar. Covers the top of the foot, and the shin. Works as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for training and light sparring
customer_reviews.text: Good for training and light sparring. My only complaint is that the pad inside tends to get folded and it's not easy straightening it out.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your activity
customer_reviews.text: Its good if your hiking (idk). It's not good for sparring.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Calvo

customer_reviews.title: Happy Customer
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was hoping for. I'll definitely be ordering more in the future. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love them and use them for every kickboxing class i ...
customer_reviews.text: Protects my delicate lady shins from getting bruised by the kickboxing heavy bag. Does the job! Cannot wear sneakers with it. I love them and use them for every kickboxing class i have!
customer_reviews.author: timry

customer_reviews.title: This one is misleading. It's pictured with shin & ...
customer_reviews.text: This one is misleading. It's pictured with shin & foot. I had never ordered one before. It arrived with only the shin.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kobylarz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my beginners Muay Thai Class. Did the job!
customer_reviews.author: CHARISSA28N

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Kickboxing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing shin gaurds. I use them 4 days a week and they are holding up great. No problems in the washer and dryer and feel great for protecting my shins on the heavy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Garofalo

customer_reviews.title: These really guard your shins!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to guard my shins in martial arts training. They work great! They are also quite long, so they reach from just below my knee pads to my ankles. Very good!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Buzon

customer_reviews.title: Do not have foot padding as shown in the description ...
customer_reviews.text: Do not have foot padding as shown in the description and do not even hook around feet. These are purely for ur shins and will move around a lot so the sides as you kick
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as pictured and works as described. Really fast shipping also!
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not the greatest protection but for the price it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Used viciously twice per week for years and still holding up strong. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Liak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to protect my banged-up shins when splitting wood. They do that job just fine, and provide some mosquito protection to boot. They would not be adequate for playing soccer and other such sports, but they aren't sold for that purpose. Apparently they cannot be washed, so will need to replace when they get too stinky.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not for Taekwondo!
customer_reviews.text: Not thinking, I purchased two sets of these for my boys for taekwondo. Taekwondo uniforms (doboks) are only to be all white. So, I donated ours to charity as mmy boys had worn them to class and I didn't feel right returning them.
customer_reviews.author: LordieLordie.

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit true to sizing, and the company won’t take returns.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Hartwell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: They seem to be holding up very well especially considering they are taking quite a beating.
customer_reviews.author: karen m.

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size!!
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is what I had ordered however the sizes are incorrect. I ordered a mediums but received a package that says medium on it with the item tag on the shin guard labeled small. This item has no return policy so now I am stuck with the wrong size
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: My shins are saved!
customer_reviews.text: When I first started sparring and clashed shins and even bled from it, I knew I needed to get shin guards. I've had these for months now and don't get bruises like I used to. They need washing occasionally as you sweat wearing them. Since they are elastic they fit snugly and barely move but are a little difficult to remove when you're sweaty but it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Tom H.

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured........BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: Item I received is not as pictured, no instep pad, just shin. Will not buy from seller again!!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for light to mid contact. Too thin for full force.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: My brother was not too happy with these. I think they could have been a little thicker....
customer_reviews.author: MMA

customer_reviews.title: These fit me perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I needed to protect my shins and feet while kicking the bag. I had to shave off some of the foot padding, but that was an easy fix. I like the quality of this company and the many pieces of sparing gear which they offer at reasonable prices. And BTW, I am a 70 year old grandmother who has recently taken up TaeKwonDoo-you can teach an old dog new tricks!
customer_reviews.author: Grannie Frannie

customer_reviews.title: good mobility. good protection for my beginning kickboxing
customer_reviews.text: prevents bruising, good mobility. good protection for my beginning kickboxing.
customer_reviews.author: edward

customer_reviews.title: " like jon jones
customer_reviews.text: im 5'11 160-170lbs and I have long legs... "chicken legs," like jon jones, my size fit perfectly, please note these shin guards are not for heavy sparring if you are not experienced, the padding seems like it will condense/smash over time with use, its nice that these shin guards can be customized adding your own artistic abilities, design your own shin guards!
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product. I use them as kicking pads in kickboxing class. Theyre very sturdy, yet not too stiff. Very good product. Great Price
customer_reviews.author: C. C.

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these to prevent (lessen) damage to my legs when mowing in heavy underbrush. Easy on and easy off and no blood letting . . . yet.
customer_reviews.author: John McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: the product arrived, but not as photo illustration, shin+instep (foot) protection, the actual thing without instep (foot) protection, disappointed !!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good guards
customer_reviews.text: Great chin guards! My husband used them when he was doing kickboxing!
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Fit nice and not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in. Fit nice and not too heavy...but plenty thick. I will use these for shin kicks on my long bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie D.

customer_reviews.title: good quality as I use them frequently and wash often ...
customer_reviews.text: Shipped quickly, good quality as I use them frequently and wash often and they haven't show much sign of wear would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Gina M.

customer_reviews.title: Good shin guards
customer_reviews.text: Nicely padded and easy to put on, take off, and wear.
customer_reviews.author: Kasi623

customer_reviews.title: Sparring gear.
customer_reviews.text: I got these for sparring in karate. I don't like the shin guards and boots that I had been using in class, so I got these and love them. WAY more comfortable and now I don't have to worry about the boots slipping over my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Fortin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these and what I revived was shin guards only- no Instep cover at all.
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Houk

customer_reviews.title: Good For Light Sparring
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for light sparring (Tang Soo Do). Easy to put on and get off (depending on how much you are sweating! :)
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

product_meta.title: ProForce Cloth Shin Instep Guard for Sparring
product_meta.description:
Covers entire kicking area from instep to top of shin. 

Great for padding injured or sensitive areas.

Handling Fee Notification

This products shipping cost now includes a $10 per order handling fee to cover added handling costs from our supplier, and is included in the shipping costs displayed on Amazon.

For more information concerning this new fee and to view our policies, shipping rates, returns information, and sizing charts please see our seller information by clicking the link above where it says "Ships from and sold by Martial Arts Equipment Direct."
feature_bullets: Great for padding injured or sensitive areas.
